page.title: 11Farming around Crowhurst.
page.content: About{two thirds}of our area is rural either{woodland or mixed farming}land. The woodland is nearly all{deciduous and covers a lot of land, particularly in the N.E. at Beauport Wood. It includes an area of Special Scientific Interest (plants, bird and insect life), which they are hoping to make bigger, at Marline Wood. There are about 12 farms in our area, with names like Park Farm, Stonebridge Farm and Breadsell Farm. Although it is mixed farming most of the land is used for{cattle grazing.}There are some sheep too. Most of the cattle are Friesian. The farmers have quite large herds, giving plenty of milk. Some crops are grown on this clay soil.There is a Nursery at High Beech. Recently farmland has been lost as the land is used for housing, factories and road development.
